instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
This unit is shutdown every 10 minuites and heat sink temperature when goes 66C then it shutdown.
I changes heatsink and fan, but no luck.Any idea what to do.No liquid  damaged history.Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
Looks like ME region issue.
Clean it with Medusa, if available.
If not, search the forum; clean BIOS, just for test, already uploaded...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message: Yes either BIOS or corrosion somewhere under the CPU/RAM/SMC etc. If not BIOS, this will suck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
[USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] : Not to derail the thread at all, but for general knowledge and future reference: what leads you to suspect the BIOS/ME is the issue in this case? Why would the ME region be related to a random-shutdown issue, without any additional information? Why not suspect bad RAM, faulty CPU/PCH, SMC, etc? I've seen many of these 00165 boards that have random-shutdown issues, all with no liquid damage or anything at all. Some last hours, some last a few minutes. Have tried BIOS (new dump and force-update/manual clean), as well as new SMC, reflow RAM (among other things) on many of them with no luck, so just curious as the reason you suspected BIOS right off the bat. Thanks! :)

I resolved 2 of them successfully; on both, the issue was with <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>/FETs. Replaced and boards continued to work fine. This did not work for several others; was hoping there would be some specific type of common fault, but it wasn't so. Also considered that many of these clean "random shutdown" boards might be manifesting symptoms that prelude the failure of one of the front tantalum caps that occurs on these every now and then. If not, I suspect they were all dropped at some point. None fail RAM tests, but maybe CPU damage. Anyway, just a thought.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
In this case is not random shutdown.
Usually suspect ME region when machine turns off at the same time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message: Interesting--thanks. I knew RAM, bad CPU (after a few starts) would typically cause shutdown at similar intervals of time, so good to know BIOS/ME can have the same effect. Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
Try this dump and comment.
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1qG0XdP8XVhJLqnXve0fc6ZTgSH2WgJ87[/url]

"Usually suspect ME region when machine turns off at the same time..."
I meant always at same time; not alwaays 10 min, as in this case.
Turning off always at 5s, or 30 min for example.

threads.message: Your dump is good one and it works now. this is kind of unusual experience. Thanks a lot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message: 00165 boards much more picky with BIOS. Did you even try to perform a clean install of High Sierra when you had a working (bootable) BIOS?? Installing High Sierra will correct ME region automatically, as long as unit will boot to installer.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
Did you reflash original chip, or used new chip?
00165 requires chip with Quad Enable (QE) bit enabled...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message: I used original working board bios chip and boot from high siera and it works for couple of hour but now again this is not boot up , shows stop sign. This is terrible and i am surprised.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A shutdown after 10 minutes
threads.message:
So you get stop sign, not restart, or stuck on logo?
Then disconnect all devices, keep only LCD and SSD.
Use external mouse/keyboard for test.
Test it with your USB OSX too.

threads.message: Try to load USB osx ( Siera)  and it stuck on logo at end of the Bar during upload osx  ,disconnect KB.
